Professor Paul Anderson is the Director of the Digital Design Studio at Glasgow School of Art and has an international profile in 3D digital visualisation and interaction research.  This profile is concerned with leading edge research into fundamental human computer interface issues particularly those associated with 3D interfaces, haptics, gesture based interaction and 3D sound. The significance of this has been recognised by a number of world-class research organisations including The Ford Motor Company and The British Defence Evaluation and Research Agency (now QinetiQ). A number of major research collaborations have taken place as a result. He has generated research income of over 3 million pounds within the past four years and published internationally on the subject of digital visualisation and interaction.

Professor Anderson studied Product Design at the Glasgow School of Art between1980-1984, followed by a Masters degree in Product Design at the Royal College of Art. He is a Fellow of The Royal Geographical Society (FRGS), and a Fellow of The Royal Society of Arts (FRSA). He is also a Member of the International Society of Optical Engineering (SPIE), a Member of the Association for Computing Machinery (ACM) and a Member of the Editorial Board of the international Journal 'Advances in Transportation Studies'. He currently sits on the Board of the Centre for Contemporary Arts Glasgow
